block.p: Experienced cooks don't need to be told that it takes two to five minutes to scramble an egg. But how long does it take to defrost a chicken breast in a microwave oven, and how long can eggs be stored?

Experienced cooks don't need to be told that it takes two to five minutes to scramble an egg. But how long does it take to defrost a chicken breast in a microwave oven, and how long can eggs be stored?

Even the best cook, who often tells when food is done by looking, listening and smelling, needs the answers to such questions, and that's where ''Timing Is Everything: The Complete Timing Guide to Cooking,'' by Jack Piccolo (Three Rivers Press, $16.95), comes in. This 436-page book proceeds, food by food, through assorted cooking methods, including pressure-cooking and microwave heating. It also covers defrosting, reheating and storage in the pantry, refrigerator and freezer. There are charts galore, all easy for the cook in a hurry to follow.
